intro: Ayenia genistella, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its root system is adapted to thrive in sandy and well-drained soils, making it drought-tolerant. Ayenia genistella is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
